Job Description: 【Join our team as a nurse!】Do you know that there are many children at a hospital in Oudong who need you? Join Japan Heart Children’s Medical Center if you want to be a part of helping them.Japan Heart Children’s Medical Center is a non-profit medical organization with a mission to provide medical care to places where it is out of reach, wherever that may be. We are looking for nurses who can share our mission. You will gain valuable experience and benefits from working with us.You will get new experience and a lot of benefit from this charity work such as:❣️ Get experience with charity work.❣️ Have opportunities to learn specialized knowledge and skills with Japanese doctors and nurses.❣️ Have a dormitory for staff.  ※We will determine if you can use it depending on the availability.❣️ Meals can be provided.(3 times/day, working days)❣️ Get a competitive salary (incentive for overtime)If you are interested in working for us, please apply for it !https://japanheartcambodia.org/join-us/nurse/　Place：C/O Ponhea Leu Referral Hospital, Chaktoteus Village, Vihear Lourng Commune, Ponhea Leu District, Kandal Province===================【ចូលរួមជាមួយក្រុមរបស់យើងជាគិលានុបដ្ឋាយិកា!】តើអ្នកដឹងទេថាមានកុមារជាច្រើនដែលមកមន្ទីរពេទ្យនៅឧដុង្គត្រូវការអ្នក?ចូលរួមជាមួយមជ្ឈមណ្ឌលព្យាបាលកុមារបេះដូងជប៉ុនឥឡូវនេះប្រសិនបើអ្នកទាំងអស់គ្នាចង់ក្លាយជាចំណែកមួយជួយទៅដល់ពួកគាត់។Japan Heart Children’s Medical Center គឺជាអង្គការវេជ្ជសាស្រ្តមិនរកប្រាក់ចំណេញ បេសកកម្មរបស់យើងគឺផ្តល់ជូននូវការថែទាំសុខភាពប្រជាជនដែលនៅតំបន់ដាច់ស្រយាល។ ពួកយើងកំពុងតែស្វែងរកបេក្ខជនដែលមានបេសកម្មដូចគ្នានឹងពួកយើងដើម្បីចូលរួមក្នុងការជួយទៅដល់កុមារទាំងអស់។អ្នកនឹងទទួលបានបទពិសោធន៍ និងអត្ថប្រយោជន៍ដ៏មានតម្លៃពីការធ្វើការជាមួយយើង។❣️ ជាបទពិសោធន៏ការងារបែបសប្បុរស❣️មានអន្តេវាសិកដ្ឋានសម្រាប់បុគ្គលិក។ ※យើងនឹងកំណត់ថាតើអ្នកអាចប្រើវាអាស្រ័យលើភាពអាចរកបាន។❣️ អាហារអាចត្រូវបានផ្តល់ជូន (មួយថ្ងៃបីដង)❣️ ប្រាក់ខែសក្តិសមបំផុតជាមួយការងារ (ទទួលបានប្រាក់បន្ថែមសំរាប់ការងារលើសម៉ោង )❣️ ទទួលបានឱកាសជាច្រើនដើម្បីទទួលបានចំណេះដឹងនិងរៀនជំនាញថ្មីពីវិជ្ជបណ្ឌិតជនជាតិជប៉ុនបើ​អ្នក​ចាប់​អារម្មណ៍​ចង់​ធ្វើ​ការ​ឱ្យ​យើង សូម​ដាក់​ពាក្យ!https://japanheartcambodia.org/join-us/nurse/
Job Requirement: Mail：medicalcenter@japanheart.orgTel : 077 838 177 - 070 820 607Facebook：https://www.facebook.com/japanheart.hospital/【Negotiable salary】$380～$800(probation term is 80% of the salary)
Company Profile:
We are a Japanese medical volunteer NGO founded in 2004 and
have been providing medical and health care to the people living in rural areas in Cambodia at our hospital in Kandal province.
Contact Info: Contact Information NGO Japan Heart Administration Manager 077 95 94 71 medicalcenter@japanheart.org #Street 5, Ampeldamtek Village, Vihear Lourng Commune, Ponhea Leu District, Kandal Province Cambodia 077 95 94 71

Job Description: Operations ManagementRun the Operation DepartmentAssign teams, establish work processes, and monitor staff performance to ensure customer satisfactionSet minimum standards for operations group to achieve in work flow processes (e.g., FCR issuance, doc dispatch, PSA and SA transmittal, etc.) Ensure teams handle their assignments in prompt, thorough, and accurate fashion (i.e., ensure staff provides qualOversee day to day operations, help resolve problems, and assist staff with difficult issuesHelp ensure smooth working relationship with all vendors, agents and service providersHandle those daily messages which require a higher level of experience and/or English proficiencyAssist staff to correctly interpret and execute customers’ instructions and working proceduresEnsure work processes (data, documentation) of operations group effectively meet company’s internal financial/accounting requirementsStaff ManagementInfluence and/or recommend hire/fire decisionsEnsure new staff is trained effectively; develop staff for growth and new responsibilitiesMonitor staff performance; conduct annual performance reviewsCross train staff to broaden their skills and to provide quality back up during vacation or sick leaveEncourage and motivate staff to achieve peak performanceInfluence and/or recommend staff salary decisionsSet positive example for staffMonitor staff performance against management standards (e.g. FCR issuance, doc dispatch, etc.). Continuously seek to improve these standardsAssist in developing business plan and/or pricing schemes for new business opportunities (as needed)Assist in management/operations of non-traditional services as neededProvide special reports and analysis as requested by management (as needed)Provide problem resolution as directed by ManagementOptimise human and other resources; demonstrate expense controlEnsure staff properly handles invoicing and other key administrative tasksProvide quality customer servicesSet example for all staff to follow in providing quality service to both external and internal customers (e.g., Accounting Dept.)Provide prompt, through and accurate response to all queries from customers or Century-U.S.  Ensure staff does sameProvide value-added services for customersEnsure customer’s satisfaction with our servicesAct as liaison with Century’s overseas offices and agents where necessaryEnsure staff members use good telephone manners and communicate in helpful, proactive fashionEnsure proactive, accurate, and timely communication is provided to consignee and Century–U.S.Data ManagementSupervise and train staff to ensure data accuracy and integrityMonitor staff performance in meeting data standards (PSA and SA transmittal/accuracy, etc.).Ensure customers understand reasons for any revisions or problem dataAssist with new systems implementation (where necessary)SalesMaintain close ties to vendor community in efforts to build customer satisfaction and to maximize business opportunitiesVisit important vendors, buying offices, trading companies and Far East offices of current and target customers as needed to maintain good rapport and Century name recognitionSales, hospitality, and/or assistance for all customers or prospective customers travelling through the RegionMaintain close ties to Shipping community and keep abreast of current eventsAssist customers in developing their logistics strategies or with cost analysisOther works arranged by Manager or Supervisor
Job Requirement: Extensive business experience within Supply Chain/Logistics or a combination of Merchandising and Supply Chain roles an assetEducation and/or work experience overseas is preferableAbility to work in a time sensitive environment and be results drivenAbility to embrace and adapt to change with a positive attitudeExcellent interpersonal and globally adaptable communication skillsUse English wellFluency in Chinese is an asset
Contact Info: Contact Information Ryan Lee HR Manager 85293472344 ryan.lee@hk.cds-net.asia Siem Reap null 85293472344
